RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 1 1M Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 8300. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE DECEMBER 11, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since November 11 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4, 000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PONTI PRIDE stalked the pace vying to put a head in front between horses on the far turn shaking clear in upper stretch holding firm in the three path. BRODYTHEOXMAN tracked the pace gaining on the far turn vying from mid track down the lane saving place. PARADE GRAND slow early rallied into the far turn coming nine wide in upper stretch angling in while finishing well. GAMBLER hustled out pursed five wide to the half pressing on the far turn weakening in upper stretch. THE NEWFIE EXPRESS set the early pace being hooked along the inside on the far turn ceding in upper stretch giving way at the rail. LAUTREC stalked the pace chasing on the far turn wearing out into upper stretch. BACK ALLEY CAT was far back early. GENERAL DIRECTION raced evenly to the far turn weakening there giving way into upper stretch.

ENTRY.NAME: The Newfie Express
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, hooked inside far turn, faded on rail lane

ENTRY.NAME: Ponti Pride
ENTRY.OWNER: Tijuana Racing Stables and Cuadra Cruz Diablo
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, led between far turn, cleared top lae, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Brodytheoxman
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace, gained far turn, bid mid track lane,

ENTRY.NAME: General Direction
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, gave way to lane

ENTRY.NAME: Lautrec
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, chased far turn, wore out lane

ENTRY.NAME: Parade Grand
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, rallied from half, nine wide top lane, angled in

ENTRY.NAME: Gambler
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled out, 5 wide to 1/2, pressed far turn, weakened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Back Alley Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: far back early

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 2 5F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 7900. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE DECEMBER 11, 2022. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MATERS N TATERS dropped off on the turn circling out to upper stretch rallying up late three deep. JAMMING CAMERON pressed the pace dueling on the turn wresting a short lead in upper stretch digging in late to outside pressure angling out ceding grudgingly. BE THE CHANGE a step slow through the turn raced six wide down the lane gaining late. MY MAE DAY slow early gained some in upper stretch finishing evenly. AW ITE pressed on the turn extending into upper stretch pausing when in close between horses late. MACHO SMOKE slow early lost ground to upper stretch running on late seven wide. SOMERSET BAY pressed the pace dueling through the turn ceding in upper stretch angling in while giving way.

ENTRY.NAME: Maters N Taters
ENTRY.COMMENT: dropped off turn, circled to lane, rallied up three deep

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Crystal Chapple DVM & Michael G. Phelps

ENTRY.NAME: My Mae Day
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, gained some top lane, finished evenly,

ENTRY.NAME: Be the Change
ENTRY.COMMENT: step slow, lagged to lane, rallied past mid track

ENTRY.NAME: Jamming Cameron
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, dueled turn, led inside of foes lane, grudgingly

ENTRY.NAME: Aw Ite
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed on turn, extended lane, in close between late

ENTRY.NAME: Somerset Bay
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, dueled turn, ceded lane, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Macho Smoke
ENTRY.OWNER: MM Racing LLC and Thomas Allison
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, wide into lane, ran on late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 3 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 66. Maiden Special Weight Purse 16500. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 118 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LIL BUT DELICIOUS advanced on the turn drawing even abreast rival in upper stretch matching strides late getting up gamely on the wire. BAYTOWN KITTY CAT came in clipping heels causing rival to stumble then take up after the break, cleared to the turn widening there before being collared in upper stretch dueling gamely inside of foe to wire. MACI'S WORLD slow early gave a mild move to upper stretch using even action to hold others safe there. THIRSTY FOR LOVE chased from the inside through the turn weakening in upper stretch. LUPITA was bumped then cut off clipping heels stumbled while being taken up shortly after the start. DON'T B CRITICAL chased early then faded on the turn. KAYLEIGH'S KITTEN came out bumping rival at the break, close early would fade on the turn. FOLLOWING AN INQUIRY BAYTOWN KITTY CAT WAS DISQUALIFIED AND PLACED FIFTH FOR INTERFERENCE WITH LUPITA AFTER THE BREAK.

ENTRY.NAME: Thirsty for Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace, weakened inside

ENTRY.NAME: Lil But Delicious
ENTRY.COMMENT: advanced turn, drew even abreast lane, got up gamely,

ENTRY.NAME: Don't B Critical
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased early. faded turn

ENTRY.NAME: Maci's World
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, evenly to lane, held others safe

ENTRY.NAME: Kayleigh's Kitten
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped foe break, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Lupita
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped then clipped heels being taken up after break

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Baytown Kitty Cat
ENTRY.OWNER: McEntee Racing Inc and Winfrey Donald S
ENTRY.COMMENT: came in clipped heels early clear turn, dueled lane, missed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 4 6F Dirt CR: 69. Maiden Special Weight Purse 16500. FOR MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STUNNING HERO away alertly pressed a narrow lead through the turn shaking clear in the four path upper stretch holding rivals at bay late. KNOCKOUT GUY pressed in bid on the turn extending from mid track down the lane holding well to the end. LIAM'S ROCKET MAN slow early saved ground to upper stretch responding to finish strong along the rail. CAB BEEF pressed then chased to upper stretch weakening late on the inside. GUARDIANSOF AUTISM gained outside on the turn racing evenly in the six path down the lane. BALLOT BOX chased on the turn then faded near mid track down the lane. BRAZILIAN SEA sent hard chased close up to the quarter pole then gave way in upper stretch. ENOUGH ICE faded on the turn. PISTOL JERRY was always outrun. DESERT JUSTICE dropped back early.

ENTRY.NAME: Enough Ice
ENTRY.COMMENT: faded on the turn

ENTRY.NAME: Cab Beef
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed then chased to lane, weakened inside

ENTRY.NAME: Stunning Hero
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, pressed on lead, shook clear lane, driving,

ENTRY.NAME: Liam's Rocket Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, saved ground to lane, finished strong on rail

ENTRY.NAME: Pistol Jerry
ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun

ENTRY.NAME: Knockout Guy
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed bid turn, extended mid track lane, held well

ENTRY.NAME: Brazilian Sea
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled along, close up to quarter pole, gave way,

ENTRY.NAME: Ballot Box
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased on turn, faded lane

ENTRY.NAME: Guardiansof Autism
ENTRY.COMMENT: gained outside turn, finished evenly,

ENTRY.NAME: Desert Justice
ENTRY.COMMENT: dropped back early

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 5 1M Dirt CR: 52. Maiden Claiming Purse 7700. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FRANCIA (PER) sent clear set the pace being hooked on the far turn responding to take charge along the inside in upper stretch holding firm to wire. STORY CHANNEL advanced on the backside drawing even between horses on the far turn ceding to inside rival in upper stretch hanging on to save place. ICY RAIN gained on the backside vying inside on the far turn checking near the rail approaching the quarter pole racing evenly down the lane. GIO'S MY DAD stalked the pace pressing three deep at the quarter pole weakening in upper stretch. STEPPINPERFECTION slow early passed a few down the lane. MEMORIES ETERNAL chased on the far turn fading at mid track in upper stretch. TEST YOUR FAITH raced mid pack tiring in upper stretch. LITTLEBITOFLASH was never involved. AN OBJECTION FROM THE RIDER OF ICY RAIN AGAINST THE RIDER OF FRANCIA FOR INTERFERENCE NEARING THE QUARTER POLE WAS DISMISSED BY THE STEWARDS.

ENTRY.NAME: Francia (PER)
ENTRY.COMMENT: sent clear, set pace, hooked far turn, responded lane

ENTRY.NAME: Story Channel
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle move, dueled between far turn, saved place

ENTRY.NAME: Memories Eternal
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased to lane, faded mid track

ENTRY.NAME: Icy Rain
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle move, bid inside far turn, checked on rail 1/4 pole

ENTRY.NAME: Littlebitoflash
ENTRY.COMMENT: never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Steppinperfection
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, passed a few lane

ENTRY.NAME: Gio's My Dad
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, pressed three deep far turn, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Test Your Faith
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, tired lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 6 6F Dirt CR: 72. Claiming Purse 7900. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 11 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STELLAR LEGACY made the lead clearing on the turn widening in upper stretch becoming leg weary late reaching the wire in time. ZIPPIN PIPPIN emerged off a loose leader to upper stretch making headway inside the sixteenth pole gaining quickly late before running out of ground. MISS SHADY raced a step slow throughout. MIMI'S HOLIDAY was never involved. TIME FOR CUPID played no factor. LA SMOOCHIE flashed early speed then faded on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: La Smoochie
ENTRY.COMMENT: flashed speed, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Time for Cupid
ENTRY.COMMENT: played no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Shady
ENTRY.COMMENT: a step slow throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Stellar Legacy
ENTRY.COMMENT: made lead, drew off to lane, leg weary late reached wire

ENTRY.NAME: Mimi's Holiday
ENTRY.COMMENT: never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Zippin Pippin
ENTRY.OWNER: Tijuana Racing Stables and Cuadra Cruz Diablo
ENTRY.COMMENT: emerged on turn, bid 4 wide lane, cloing in on tiring leader

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 7 1M Dirt CR: 86. Allowance Purse 18800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since November 11 Allowed 3 lbs. (Claiming Races For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Estimating Allowances) (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FAST FALL set the pace being hooked on the far turn dueling on the inside of rival down the stretch battling gamely to gain a share. BLUNDER stalked the pace pressing to draw even on the far turn dueling abreast rival down the stretch hitting the wire in tandem. TIMESATAPPIN slow early lagged to upper stretch responding there to close willingly the final eighth. NICKANDME raced evenly lacking more. TOBI WAN KENOBI folded up on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Nickandme
ENTRY.OWNER: Tackett Paul W and Smith Sr Franklin G
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly, lacked more

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Fast Fall
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, hooked far turn, dueled on inside, gamely for share

ENTRY.NAME: Tobi Wan Kenobi
ENTRY.COMMENT: folded up on far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Timesatappin
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, lagged to lane, responded to finish well

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Blunder
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, drew even far turn, dueled abreast lane, in tandem

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MOUNTAINEER RACE TRACK AND RACE 8 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 7800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 121 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 11 Allowed 3 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Bred Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TIMBERRY TIDDLER stalked the pace drawing even on the turn dueling abreast rival in upper stretch edging clear late. SHAKIN IT BIG TIME rallied on the turn drawing even on the inside in upper stretch ceding grudgingly late. RESVALON chased the pace looming into upper stretch lacking a closing surge. JOHN'S KID slow early raced evenly through the lane passing a few there. VAPORIZED alert to clear early was passed on the turn weakening in upper stretch. IN THE GOSPEL chased close up through the turn wearing out in upper stretch. ANGELUS DIAMOND played no factor. BARELYSTILLCOUNTS well back early raced wide through the lane. OXBOW'S RIDE was always outrun. BOURBON MOMENT steadied near the seven sixteenths pole would fade to upper stretch. AN OBJECTION FROM THE RIDER OF BOURBON MONENT AGAINST THE RIDER OF TIMBERRY TIDDLER FOR INTERFERENCE NEAR THE SEVEN SIXTEENTHS POLE WAS DISMISSED BY THE STEWARDS.

ENTRY.NAME: John's Kid
ENTRY.COMMENT: slow early, lagged to lane, passed a couple

ENTRY.NAME: Shakin It Big Time
ENTRY.COMMENT: rallied on the turn, drew even inside top lane, saved place

ENTRY.NAME: Vaporized
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pace, passed on turn, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Bourbon Moment
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied, 7/16, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Resvalon
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased pace loomed into lane, lacked late response,

ENTRY.NAME: Timberry Tiddler
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, drew even turn, dueled abreast lane, went clear

ENTRY.NAME: Barelystillcounts
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back early, wide lane

ENTRY.NAME: Angelus Diamond
ENTRY.COMMENT: played no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Oxbow's Ride
ENTRY.COMMENT: always outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: In the Gospel
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased close up, faded late
